revised_title: Anatomy of the Iris and its Muscular Structure
tldr: Professor Maunoir's study on the muscularity of the iris reveals that it contains two sets of muscles: an orbicular muscle surrounding the pupillary margin and a radiated muscle extending from the exterior circumference to the ciliary ligament. These muscles control the size of the pupil. The study includes evidence from various animal dissections and a case of a woman with a unique eye injury.
